metadata.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5.1.0
metadata.description: EAP Version should be 5.1.0

metadata.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5.1.2
metadata.description: EAP Version should be 5.1.2

metadata.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5.1.1
metadata.description: EAP Version should be 5.1.1

metadata.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5.0.0
metadata.description: EAP Version should be 5.0.0

metadata.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5.0.1
metadata.description: EAP Version should be 5.0.1

metadata.title: Ensure JMX Console is either secured or removed
metadata.description: Ensure JMX Console is either secured or removed

metadata.title: Ensure Web Console is either secured or removed
metadata.description: Ensure Web Console is either secured or removed

metadata.title: Ensure Admin Console is either secured or removed
metadata.description: Ensure Admin Console is either secured or removed

metadata.title: SNMP must not be deployed
metadata.description: SNMP must not be deployed

metadata.title: Disable AJP from JBoss Web
metadata.description: All AJP Connectors should be removed from JBOSS_HOME/server/production/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml.

metadata.title: Clustering High-Availability must be disabled
metadata.description: Disable the HA Naming service interface via HTTP.

metadata.title: Ensure Technology Preview components are disabled
metadata.description: PicketLink technology preview folder should be deleted.

metadata.title: Ensure all required information is displayed in Audit Logger
metadata.description: The Security Audit Appender must log all identified information.

metadata.title: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be configured to prevent unprivileged access using authentication
metadata.description: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be configured to prevent unprivileged access using authN

metadata.title: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be configured to prevent unprivileged access using authorization
metadata.description: The jmx-invoker-service.xml is a service that exposes the JMX MBeanServer interface via an RMI compatible interface using the RMI/JRMP detached invoker service. Access control for authenticated users must be configured using the interceptors of either org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.RolesAuthorization or org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.ExternalizableRolesAuthorization.

metadata.title: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be configured to prevent unprivileged access using authorization
metadata.description: The jmx-invoker-service.xml is a service that exposes the JMX MBeanServer interface via an RMI compatible interface using the RMI/JRMP detached invoker service. Access control for authenticated users must be configured using the interceptors of either org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.RolesAuthorization or org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.ExternalizableRolesAuthorization.

metadata.title: Ensure default HSQLDB is disabled
metadata.description: All files for the default HSQLDB should be deleted.

metadata.title: Ensure HSQLDB Security Domain is removed
metadata.description: Security Domain for the default HSQLDB should be removed.

metadata.title: Ensure Security Audit Appender is enabled
metadata.description: The log4j configuration file must have an AUDIT appender uncommented.

metadata.title: Ensure Security Audit Provider is enabled
metadata.description: The log4j configuration file must have a security audit provider uncommented.

metadata.title: Ensure Configure SecurityInterceptor logging level is set correctly
metadata.description: SecurityInterceptor logging level should be set to TRACE and Reference the AUDIT Appender.

metadata.title: Ensure logging is enabled for ServerImpl log messages
metadata.description: Ensure logging is enabled for ServerImpl log messages.

metadata.title: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be secured against web attacks
metadata.description: The JMXInvokerServlet servlet must be secured against web attacks

metadata.title: The allRolesMode must be configured appropriately
metadata.description: The allRolesMode within JBOSS_HOME/server/production/deploy/jbossweb.sar/server.xml must be set to strict. This requires the authenticated user to be assigned to one of the web-app/security-role/role-name roles in order to be authorized.

metadata.title: Configure Java Security Manager to use an environment specific policy
metadata.description: The Java Security Manager is a crucial piece of the Java security infrastructure. JBoss Enterprise Application Platform should be configured to load a Java security policy that has been vetted for use in the environment. This precludes the use of the simple default policy that ships with JBoss, but does not preclude the use of preconfigured policy files like the security policy designed for use in a Common Criteria environment (See JBoss Common Criteria Configuration Guide for details).

metadata.title: Production applications should not log output to the JBoss console
Disable Hot Deployment in production
DefaultCacheTimeout must be configured properly

ind:xmlfilecontent_test.comment: Audit Logging Must Log all Information
HSQLDB Security Domain must be removed
AUDIT appender must not be commented
AUDIT appender must not be commented
SecurityInterceptor logging level is set correctly
ServerImpl logging level is set correctly

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Java Security Manager to use security_ccpolicy

constant_variable.comment: server profile OVAL content is run against
